verses.text_plain: And it came to pass after this, that Absalom the son of David had a fair sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.
verses.verse_html: 1And it came to pass after this, that Absalom the son of David had a fair sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.

tokens.text: And it came to pass after

verses.text_plain: And Amnon was so vexed, that he fell sick for his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin; and Amnon thought it hard for him to do any thing to her.
verses.verse_html:
2And Amnon was so vexed, that he fell sick for his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin; and Amnon thought it hard for him to do any thing to her. ▼
▼ Amnon thought…: Heb. it was marvellous, or, hidden in the eyes of Amnon

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Amnon thought…: Heb. it was marvellous, or, hidden in the eyes of Amnon
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Amnon thought…: Heb. it was marvellous, or, hidden in the eyes of Amnon

verses.text_plain: But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother: and Jonadab was a very subtil man.
verses.verse_html: 3But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother: and Jonadab was a very subtil man.

verses.text_plain: And he said unto him, Why art thou, being the king’s son, lean from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? And Amnon said unto him, I love Tamar, my brother Absalom’s sister.
verses.verse_html:
4And he said unto him, Why art thou, being the king’s son, lean from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? And Amnon said unto him, I love Tamar, my brother Absalom’s sister. ▼
▼ lean: Heb. thin
 , ▼
▼ from day…: Heb. morning by morning

footnotes.body_text: ▼ from day…: Heb. morning by morning
footnotes.body_html: ▼ from day…: Heb. morning by morning

verses.text_plain: And Jonadab said unto him, Lay thee down on thy bed, and make thyself sick: and when thy father cometh to see thee, say unto him, I pray thee, let my sister Tamar come, and give me meat, and dress the meat in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it at her hand.
verses.verse_html: 5And Jonadab said unto him, Lay thee down on thy bed, and make thyself sick: and when thy father cometh to see thee, say unto him, I pray thee, let my sister Tamar come, and give me meat, and dress the meat in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it at her hand.

tokens.text: unto him, I pray thee, let my sister

verses.text_plain: So Amnon lay down, and made himself sick: and when the king was come to see him, Amnon said unto the king, I pray thee, let Tamar my sister come, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat at her hand.
verses.verse_html: 6So Amnon lay down, and made himself sick: and when the king was come to see him, Amnon said unto the king, I pray thee, let Tamar my sister come, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat at her hand.

verses.text_plain: Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon’s house, and dress him meat.
verses.verse_html: 7Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon’s house, and dress him meat.

verses.text_plain: So Tamar went to her brother Amnon’s house; and he was laid down. And she took flour, and kneaded it, and made cakes in his sight, and did bake the cakes.
verses.verse_html:
8So Tamar went to her brother Amnon’s house; and he was laid down. And she took flour, and kneaded it, and made cakes in his sight, and did bake the cakes. ▼
▼ flour: or, paste

verses.text_plain: And she took a pan, and poured them out before him; but he refused to eat. And Amnon said, Have out all men from me. And they went out every man from him.
verses.verse_html: 9And she took a pan, and poured them out before him; but he refused to eat. And Amnon said, Have out all men from me. And they went out every man from him.

tokens.text: from me. And they went out

verses.text_plain: And Amnon said unto Tamar, Bring the meat into the chamber, that I may eat of thine hand. And Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.
verses.verse_html: 10And Amnon said unto Tamar, Bring the meat into the chamber, that I may eat of thine hand. And Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.

verses.text_plain: And when she had brought them unto him to eat, he took hold of her, and said unto her, Come lie with me, my sister.
verses.verse_html: 11And when she had brought them unto him to eat, he took hold of her, and said unto her, Come lie with me, my sister.

verses.text_plain: And she answered him, Nay, my brother, do not force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: do not thou this folly.
verses.verse_html:
12And she answered him, Nay, my brother, do not force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: do not thou this folly. ▼
▼ force…: Heb. humble me
 , ▼
▼ no such…: Heb. it ought not so to be done

tokens.text: me; for no such thing ought

footnotes.body_html: ▼ force…: Heb. humble me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ no such…: Heb. it ought not so to be done
footnotes.body_html: ▼ no such…: Heb. it ought not so to be done

verses.text_plain: And I, whither shall I cause my shame to go? and as for thee, thou shalt be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.
verses.verse_html: 13And I, whither shall I cause my shame to go? and as for thee, thou shalt be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.

tokens.text: And I, whither shall I cause my shame
and as for thee, thou shalt be as one
Now therefore, I pray thee, speak

verses.text_plain: Howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice: but, being stronger than she, forced her, and lay with her.
verses.verse_html: 14Howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice: but, being stronger than she, forced her, and lay with her.

verses.text_plain: Then Amnon hated her exceedingly; so that the hatred wherewith he hated her was greater than the love wherewith he had loved her. And Amnon said unto her, Arise, be gone.
verses.verse_html:
15Then Amnon hated her exceedingly; so that the hatred wherewith he hated her was greater than the love wherewith he had loved her. And Amnon said unto her, Arise, be gone. ▼
▼ exceedingly: Heb. with great hatred greatly

footnotes.body_text: ▼ exceedingly: Heb. with great hatred greatly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ exceedingly: Heb. with great hatred greatly

verses.text_plain: And she said unto him, There is no cause: this evil in sending me away is greater than the other that thou didst unto me. But he would not hearken unto her.
verses.verse_html: 16And she said unto him, There is no cause: this evil in sending me away is greater than the other that thou didst unto me. But he would not hearken unto her.

verses.text_plain: Then he called his servant that ministered unto him, and said, Put now this woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.
verses.verse_html: 17Then he called his servant that ministered unto him, and said, Put now this woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.

verses.text_plain: And she had a garment of divers colours upon her: for with such robes were the king’s daughters that were virgins apparelled. Then his servant brought her out, and bolted the door after her.
verses.verse_html: 18And she had a garment of divers colours upon her: for with such robes were the king’s daughters that were virgins apparelled. Then his servant brought her out, and bolted the door after her.

tokens.text: upon her: for with such robes

verses.text_plain: And Tamar put ashes on her head, and rent her garment of divers colours that was on her, and laid her hand on her head, and went on crying.
verses.verse_html: 19And Tamar put ashes on her head, and rent her garment of divers colours that was on her, and laid her hand on her head, and went on crying.

verses.text_plain: And Absalom her brother said unto her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee? but hold now thy peace, my sister: he is thy brother; regard not this thing. So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom’s house.
verses.verse_html:
20And Absalom her brother said unto her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee? but hold now thy peace, my sister: he is thy brother; regard not this thing. So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom’s house. ▼
▼ Amnon: Heb. Aminon
 , ▼
▼ regard…: Heb. set not thy heart
 , ▼
▼ desolate: Heb. and desolate

tokens.text: been with thee? but hold now thy peace

footnotes.body_text: ▼ regard…: Heb. set not thy heart
footnotes.body_html: ▼ regard…: Heb. set not thy heart
▼ desolate: Heb. and desolate

verses.text_plain: But when king David heard of all these things, he was very wroth.
verses.verse_html: 21But when king David heard of all these things, he was very wroth.

verses.text_plain: And Absalom spake unto his brother Amnon neither good nor bad: for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.
verses.verse_html: 22And Absalom spake unto his brother Amnon neither good nor bad: for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass after two full years, that Absalom had sheepshearers in Baal–hazor, which is beside Ephraim: and Absalom invited all the king’s sons.
verses.verse_html: 23And it came to pass after two full years, that Absalom had sheepshearers in Baal–hazor, which is beside Ephraim: and Absalom invited all the king’s sons.

tokens.text: And it came to pass after two full

verses.text_plain: And Absalom came to the king, and said, Behold now, thy servant hath sheepshearers; let the king, I beseech thee, and his servants go with thy servant.
verses.verse_html: 24And Absalom came to the king, and said, Behold now, thy servant hath sheepshearers; let the king, I beseech thee, and his servants go with thy servant.

tokens.text: I beseech thee, and his servants

verses.text_plain: And the king said to Absalom, Nay, my son, let us not all now go, lest we be chargeable unto thee. And he pressed him: howbeit he would not go, but blessed him.
verses.verse_html: 25And the king said to Absalom, Nay, my son, let us not all now go, lest we be chargeable unto thee. And he pressed him: howbeit he would not go, but blessed him.

tokens.text: let us not all now go

verses.text_plain: Then said Absalom, If not, I pray thee, let my brother Amnon go with us. And the king said unto him, Why should he go with thee?
verses.verse_html: 26Then said Absalom, If not, I pray thee, let my brother Amnon go with us. And the king said unto him, Why should he go with thee?

tokens.text: If not, I pray thee, let my brother
unto him, Why should he go

verses.text_plain: But Absalom pressed him, that he let Amnon and all the king’s sons go with him.
verses.verse_html: 27But Absalom pressed him, that he let Amnon and all the king’s sons go with him.

verses.text_plain: Now Absalom had commanded his servants, saying, Mark ye now when Amnon’s heart is merry with wine, and when I say unto you, Smite Amnon; then kill him, fear not: have not I commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant.
verses.verse_html:
28Now Absalom had commanded his servants, saying, Mark ye now when Amnon’s heart is merry with wine, and when I say unto you, Smite Amnon; then kill him, fear not: have not I commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant. ▼
▼ have…: or, will you not, since I have commanded you?
 , ▼
▼ valiant: Heb. sons of valour

footnotes.body_text: ▼ have…: or, will you not, since I have commanded you?
footnotes.body_html: ▼ have…: or, will you not, since I have commanded you?
▼ valiant: Heb. sons of valour

verses.text_plain: And the servants of Absalom did unto Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king’s sons arose, and every man gat him up upon his mule, and fled.
verses.verse_html:
29And the servants of Absalom did unto Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king’s sons arose, and every man gat him up upon his mule, and fled. ▼
▼ gat…: Heb. rode

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, while they were in the way, that tidings came to David, saying, Absalom hath slain all the king’s sons, and there is not one of them left.
verses.verse_html: 30And it came to pass, while they were in the way, that tidings came to David, saying, Absalom hath slain all the king’s sons, and there is not one of them left.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, while they were in the way

verses.text_plain: Then the king arose, and tare his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.
verses.verse_html: 31Then the king arose, and tare his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.

verses.text_plain: And Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother, answered and said, Let not my lord suppose that they have slain all the young men the king’s sons; for Amnon only is dead: for by the appointment of Absalom this hath been determined from the day that he forced his sister Tamar.
verses.verse_html:
32And Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David’s brother, answered and said, Let not my lord suppose that they have slain all the young men the king’s sons; for Amnon only is dead: for by the appointment of Absalom this hath been determined from the day that he forced his sister Tamar. ▼
▼ appointment: Heb. mouth
 , ▼
▼ determined: or, settled

verses.text_plain: Now therefore let not my lord the king take the thing to his heart, to think that all the king’s sons are dead: for Amnon only is dead.
verses.verse_html: 33Now therefore let not my lord the king take the thing to his heart, to think that all the king’s sons are dead: for Amnon only is dead.

tokens.text: Now therefore let not my lord

verses.text_plain: But Absalom fled. And the young man that kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came much people by the way of the hill side behind him.
verses.verse_html: 34But Absalom fled. And the young man that kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came much people by the way of the hill side behind him.

verses.text_plain: And Jonadab said unto the king, Behold, the king’s sons come: as thy servant said, so it is.
verses.verse_html:
35And Jonadab said unto the king, Behold, the king’s sons come: as thy servant said, so it is. ▼
▼ as thy…: Heb. according to the word of thy servant

footnotes.body_text: ▼ as thy…: Heb. according to the word of thy servant
footnotes.body_html: ▼ as thy…: Heb. according to the word of thy servant

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of speaking, that, behold, the king’s sons came, and lifted up their voice and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept very sore.
verses.verse_html:
36And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of speaking, that, behold, the king’s sons came, and lifted up their voice and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept very sore. ▼
▼ very…: Heb. with a great weeping greatly

tokens.text: And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end

footnotes.body_text: ▼ very…: Heb. with a great weeping greatly
footnotes.body_html: ▼ very…: Heb. with a great weeping greatly

verses.text_plain: But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, king of Geshur. And David mourned for his son every day.
verses.verse_html:
37But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, king of Geshur. And David mourned for his son every day. ▼
▼ Ammihud: or, Ammihur

verses.text_plain: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
verses.verse_html: 38So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.

verses.text_plain: And the soul of king David longed to go forth unto Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead.
verses.verse_html:
39And the soul of king David longed to go forth unto Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead. ▼
▼ longed: or, was consumed

footnotes.body_html: ▼ longed: or, was consumed
